ygData.subject: RE: AC Dilemma
ygData.msgSnippet: now if i per chance get anymore lambent stones by killing hg s or something like that, i ll just trade it in for the staff in the temple.  get some xp out of
ygData.messageBody:
now if i per chance get anymore lambent stones by killing hg's or something
like that, i'll just trade it in for the staff in the temple. get some xp
out of it, and then give it or sell it for peanuts

On another note, i been aching to get the breastplate and last night i
finally convinced a couple friends to go to mm. But i didnt want to risk
goin in without our druid or wizard as they werent on. Well i do a /who all
30 50 and there's a level 50 druid in the zone.... hmmmm i give him a tell
and ask him what hes killing, he tells me musicians, i ended up invising all
the way there (running by the biggest train i've seen in that zone hehe) and
i ended up getting a lute and got my bp. And a couple musicians earlier i
got a werewolf talon to get my buddy his crafted bp. Needless to say it was
a good night as i got 2 needed items, and got the xp for both breastplate
quests And i have a crested helm and a lambent helm, but i prefer the
crested, the druid i was with had a friend that needed the helm, so i sold
it to him for the cost of the gems and lambent stone. Hey they guy helped me
get a very important piece of my armor, so making no profit on it was
nothing that troubled me.

sometimes life is good....

Minkin
Sol ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [SMTP:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 09, 1999 11:47 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] AC Dilemma
>
> Love ya Minkin! My friends are trying to sell theirs for
> 400PP on Sol Ro... it's insane! I told them I would tell any bard I saw
> not
> to pay over 20pp for it so thanks for unknowingly backing me up :-)
>
> Tani 16th Bard
> Halana 34th Shaman (I have a pet now ahahahaha)
> Solusek Ro
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: CYR, Thierry [mailto:tcyr@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 09, 1999 7:10 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] AC Dilemma
>
> From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>
>
> If its any comfort for you i've never paid
> over 20pp for a stone, except the
> first one i paid 70 for cause i was
> desperate.... most of the stones i've
> gotten for 15pp. i've had a few whine that
> it worth way more then that, but
> i just laughed at them and wished em luck...
>
> Minkin
> Sol Ro
> Lev 36 questing fool
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Daniel P. Sniderman
> [SMTP:fuzzbone@...]
> > Sent: Monday, November 08, 1999 11:08 PM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] AC Dilemma
> >
> > From: "Daniel P. Sniderman"
> <fuzzbone@...>
> >
> > A week ago I had a guy auctioning a stone.
> I offered 30. He said I was
> > insane - that they were "worth 100". I
> try to explain simple economics -
> > that item is worth what people are willing
> to pay for it. I was willing
> > to
> > pay no more than 100pp. He launched into
> a diatribe about how difficult
> > it
> > would be for me to kill a Hill Giant at my
> level (I was 25 at the time -
> > he
> > was 35).
> >
> > I said fine - and if someone else would
> pay 100 - then good for them. I
> > don't know whether he found a bard who
> paid the 100 or not. I expect he
> > did. Probably the kind of bard I got into
> an argument with last night.
> > He
> > never twisted songs. And only played Jig
> of Vigor - never Hymn between
> > battles. He insisted it increased mana
> recovery by 10-15 percent. When I
> > told it didn't he laughed and said "That
> old rumor". He insisted that he
> > tested it and it did work...
> > Interestingly enough - one of my
> guildmates - a 28 cleric insisted that it
> > did speed his mana recovery. This guy
> lives in bumblef*** Wisconsin and
> > goes linkdead on average once every 30-45
> minutes. PL was bad for me last
> > night for me (I have DSL and usually get
> really good connectivity) - and
> > given the quality of his connection - I
> would assume he gets REALLY bad
> > PL.
> > It wouldn't surprise me if Jig does help
> with refresh in these cases...
> >
> > Slyde
> >
> > PS by bumblef* Wisconsin I don't mean to
> denigrate Wisconsin as a whole -
> > but do have to point out that the Packers
> lost to the Bears yesterday (:
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Jared J. Zdrojowy <jzdro@...>
> > To: <eqbards@onelist.com>

> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] AC Dilemma

> <jzdro@...>

> 30PP. His original auction was for

> in thier place. =) It also helps
> > if
> > > you're the only Bard in the zone. I may
> take your suggestions and head
> > to
> > > Perma and Guk and see if I can get some
> looting rights =).
> > >
> > > Alynae Shadowdancer
> > > 21St Song, Povar
> > >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: James C. French
> <condra@...>
> > > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> <eqbards@onelist.com>
> > > Date: Monday, November 08, 1999 3:09 PM
> > > Subject: Re: [eqbards] AC Dilemma
> > >
> > >
> > > >From: "James C. French"
> <condra@...>
> > > >
> > > >I got lambert greves at 23. Use your
> invise song and hit guk and perma
> > to
> > > >get shin and icy greves respectively
> if you spend some time ~ 2 hour
> > in
> > > >both dungons for me you can reqest
> looting rights for the armor. As it
> > is
> > > >lore and heavy it is bad loot to most
> of the casters hunting there and
> > thay
> > > >willing let you loot and watch your
> back. Good luck to you you will
> > need
> > > 110
> > > >pp to by gems to do quest. Maybe
> another 100 pp if you buy your
> > lambert.
> > > >Lambert stones are acutiong around 100
> pp ( i will not pay that im to
> > > >cheep )
> > > >
> > > >-----Original Message-----
> > > >From: Daniel P. Sniderman
> <fuzzbone@...>
> > > >To: EQ Bards <eqbards@onelist.com>
> > > >Date: Monday, November 08, 1999 12:05
> AM
> > > >Subject: [eqbards] AC Dilemma
> > > >
> > > >
> > > >>From: "Daniel P. Sniderman"
> <fuzzbone@...>
> > > >>
> > > >> Call me indecisive - but money
> accumulates in my bank - cause I
> > can
> > > >never decide what to spend it on. I
> have in the neighborhood of 850pp.
> > > I'm
> > > >not too thrilled with my armor. Mostly
> some banded still a lot of
> > barbed,
> > > >etc. A few pieces of bronze. I'm at
> level 26 btw - so I'm almost at
> > the
> > > >point where I can think about questing
> for Lambent.
> > > >>
> > > >> But anyway - I got to the armor
> store in E Freeport and look at
> > the
> > > >Steel Plate. I notice that they mostly
> offer 1 or 2 AC points above
> > the
> > > >equivalent banded. Same as Bronze with
> a small weight saving.
> > Question
> > > >is - is it worth it? How important is
> one or two AC points? How
> > important
> > > >is 2 or 3 but giving up STR or whatever
> bonuses. I have Blackened Iron
> > > >Shoulders. It says "Magic Item". What
> does this actually provide? Is
> > the
> > > >Steel Pauldron the equivalent? Pretty
> annoying you can't tell without
> > > >buying and then you can sell it at a
> fraction of what you pay for it if
> > you
> > > >make a mistake (obviously forcing you
> to check website like
> > EQualizer...
> > > >>
> > > >> Anyone have any other suggestions
> on what to spend money on? For
> > > weaps
> > > >I'm using Dirk and Barbed Leather Whip.
> > > >>
> > > >>Thanks!
> > > >>
> > > >>Slyde
